properties.description: PackageId is set by this system. But if you are updating and exisiting GBIF resource, the you can set this yourself.
properties.title: packageId

properties.description: The 'title' field provides a description of the resource that is being documented that is long enough to differentiate it from other similar resources. Multiple titles may be provided, particularly when trying to express the title in more than one language
properties.title: Title

properties.description: The date on which the resource was published
properties.title: Published Date

properties.description: The language in which the resource (not the metadata document) is written
properties.title: Language

properties.description: A brief overview describing the dataset
properties.title: Abstract

properties.description: This field names a keyword or key phrase that concisely describes the resource or is related to the resource. Each keyword field should contain one and only one keyword
properties.title: keyword

properties.description: The name of the official keyword thesaurus from which keyword was derived
properties.title: Keyword Thesaurus

properties.description: Contain a rights management statement for the resource, or reference a service providing such information
A description of the purpose of the resource/dataset
properties.title: Purpose description

properties.description: The creator is the person who created the resource (not necessarily the author of this metadata about the resource). This is the person or institution to contact with questions about the use, interpretation of a dataset.
properties.title: Creator

properties.description: The party responsible for the creation of the metadata document
properties.title: Metadata Provider

properties.description: A party associated with the resource. Parties have particular roles.
Use this field to describe the role the party played with respect to the resource. Some potential roles include technician, reviewer, principal investigator, and many others.
properties.title: role

properties.description: The URL of the resource that is available online. Note: You can leave "system" as value to autogenerate this value from the Object's URL in this repository.
Describes the extent of the coverage of the resource in terms of its spatial extent, temporal extent, and taxonomic extent
properties.title: Coverage

properties.description: A short text description of a dataset's geographic areal domain. A text description is especially important to provide a geographic setting when the extent of the dataset cannot be well described by the "boundingCoordinates
properties.title: Geographic Description

properties.description: This field specifies temporal coverage, and allows coverages to be a single point in time, multiple points in time, or a range of dates.
properties.title: Temporal Coverage

properties.description: The SingleDateTime field is intended to describe a single date and time for an event
properties.title: single Date Time

properties.description: Taxonomic Coverage is a container for taxonomic information about a resource. It includes a list of species names (or higher level ranks) from one or more classification systems.
properties.title: Taxonomic Coverage

properties.description: A general description of the range of taxa addressed in the data set or collection
properties.title: General Taxonomic Coverage

properties.description: Information about the range of taxa addressed in the dataset or collection
properties.title: Taxonomic Classification

properties.description: The name of the taxonomic rank for which the Taxon rank value is provided, e.g., Phylum, Class, Genus, Species
properties.title: Taxon Rank Name

properties.description: The name representing the taxonomic rank of the taxon being described
properties.title: Taxon Rank Value

properties.description: Applicable common names; these common names may be general descriptions of a group of organisms if appropriate, e.g., invertebrates, waterfowl
properties.title: Common Names

properties.description: Current primary contact for the dataset. The creator of the resource might be dead, left the organisation or doesnt want to be bothered.
properties.title: Primary Contact

properties.description: The methods field documents scientific methods used in the collection of this dataset. It includes information on items such as tools, instrument calibration and software.
properties.title: Methods

properties.description: The methodStep field allows for repeated sets of elements that document a series of procedures followed to produce a data object. These include text descriptions of the procedures, relevant literature, software, instrumentation, source data and any quality control measures taken.
properties.title: Description

properties.description: The field studyExtent represents both a specific sampling area and the sampling frequency (temporal boundaries, frequency of occurrence). The geographic studyExtent is usually a surrogate (representative area of) for the larger area documented in the "studyAreaDescription".

The sampling Description field allows for a text-based/human readable description of the sampling procedures used in the research project. The content of this element would be similar to a description of sampling procedures found in the methods section of a journal article.
properties.title: Sampling Description

properties.description: The qualityControl field provides a location for the description of actions taken to either control or assess the quality of data resulting from the associated method step.
properties.title: Quality Control Description

properties.description: The project field contains information on the project in which this dataset was collected. It includes information such as project personnel, funding, study area, project design and related projects.
properties.title: Project

properties.description: The Personnel field extends ResponsibleParty with role information and is used to document people involved in a research project by providing contact information and their role in the project.
properties.title: Personnel

properties.description: Use this field to describe the role the party played with respect to the resource. Some potential roles include technician, reviewer, principal investigator, and many others.
properties.title: role

properties.description: The funding field is used to provide information about funding sources for the project such as: grant and contract numbers; names and addresses of funding sources.
properties.title: Funding Description

properties.description: The studyAreaDescription field documents the physical area associated with the research project. It can include descriptions of the geographic, temporal, and taxonomic coverage of the research location and descriptions of domains (themes) of interest such as climate, geology, soils or disturbances.

This element contains the additional metadata to be included in the document. This element should be used for extending EML to include metadata that is not already available in another part of the EML specification.
properties.title: Additional Metadata

properties.description: A single citation for use when citing the dataset
properties.title: Citation

properties.description: A single citation for use when citing the dataset
properties.title: Citation

properties.description: A URI, DOI or other persistent identifier for the citation
properties.title: Citation ID

properties.description: A list of citations that form a bibliography on literature related / used in the dataset
properties.title: Bibliography (references)

properties.description: A single citation for this bibliographic reference
A URI, DOI or other persistent identifier for the citation
properties.title: Citation ID
